result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua D. Day

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua D. Day in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 16CM172, 16CM181, 16CM254, 17CM6.  Plea agreement.  17CM6 plea Ct 1, ct 2 DRI   16cm254 plea,  16CM181 Plea   16CM172 to be DRI   18 month prison, 12 month IC 6 ES, stay probation 24 months with conditions   Concurrent    16CM254 Restitution $400.00 16CM172 $99.88  Probation  to be 18 months.   Counsel agrees and def agrees with plea agreement.    Plea advisement form completed and reviewed on record.  16CM181 Ct 1 no contest   16CM254 Ct 1 No contest   17CM6 Ct 1 No contest plea.   Ct 2 Dismissed and read in.  17CM172 dismissed and read in consistent with plea agreement.   Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Court finds pleas entered freely & voluntarily.  Def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis . Pleas accepted, found guilty.  State gives sentencing arguments.  Sentencing arguments by Atty Goetz.   Nothing by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  16CM181 18 mo prison 12 mon IC 6 mo ES stayed  18 months probation Cost & DNA surcharge   and DNA sample   AODA assessment & follow through   Counseling  as recommended by agent.  No contact with Thomas Pelky  16CM254 same sentence   18 month prison, 12 mo IC & 6 mo ES stayed  probation 18 months.  cost & DNA surcharge  $400.00 restitution. AODA and follow through. Counseling   No contact with Laura Solin   17CM6  18 month prison  12 mo IC & 6 mo ES  stayed  18 month probation.   Restitution $99.88 from 16CM172  Cost  AODA & follow through.  Counseling    No credit.   Def is eligible for both programs, earned released, substance abuse  DNA sample already provided.     If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Same sentence on each,  all to run concurrent.  Post convictions rights.
